channel.title: SPZ Tech & Innovation Feed
channel.description: Curated tech, AI, and innovation news from BBC and Israeli sources

item.title: Trump orders government to stop using Anthropic in battle over AI use
item.description: The move announced on social media comes after a standoff between Anthropic's boss and the US Department of Defense. Tech/AI policy news with major implications.

item.title: OpenAI vows safety policy changes after Tumbler Ridge shooting
item.description: Canada's AI minister will meet CEO Sam Altman next week after the suspect's ChatGPT account was not flagged to police despite internal company concerns.

item.title: The AI videos supercharging Russia's online disinformation campaigns
item.description: Security experts have warned that Western governments are poorly equipped to counter a new frontier of online disinformation.

item.title: Drone jammed near French aircraft carrier was Russian, says Sweden
item.description: Sweden's prime minister said it was a serious but not unexpected incident - and a "Russian way of acting that we recognise from other places".

item.title: 'Obnoxious' AI chatbot talked about its mother, customers say
item.description: Australian supermarket giant Woolworths tweaks its AI-powered assistant after users said it gave them the "ick".

item.title: These filmmakers know exactly how to get you hooked on bizarre one-minute dramas
item.description: The business depends on packing a punch right away because the first five to 10 episodes are free.

item.title: Formula 1's new golden age of celebrity may have just begun
item.description: As the eighth series of Netflix's hugely popular Drive To Survive is released this weekend, has Formula 1 become one big celebrity playground?

item.title: Resident Evil is back - can it redefine the survival horror genre once more?
item.description: Director Koshi Nakanishi says balancing action and horror within the game has been a huge challenge.
